segment.target: တဘၣ်တၢ်ပာ်ပနီၣ်

source.pc: Welcome to MCB’s Online Training for Peer Specialists
These free online training programs explore a variety of topics to help you succeed as a peer and work effectively with those beginning or continuing their recovery journey.

Our training programs provide you with the knowledge and skills to better support the persons you serve on their recovery journey. The programs educate and challenge your understanding about opioids and substance use as well as build mindfulness of cultural differences and your ability to navigate those differences.
Funding for this training is made possible through a grant from the Minnesota Department of Human Services Behavioral Health Division.
Self-register to begin or, if you are a returning learner, sign in to continue your training.
For any technical or connection issues, please email {0}.

target.pc: လၢနစးထီၣ်အဂီၢ် ဆဲးလီၤနမံၤ မ့တမ့ၢ်, နမ့မ့ၢ်ပှၤတဂၤလၢ အဟဲက့ၤမၤလိက့ၤကဒီးတၢ်အဃိ, ဆဲးလီၤမံၤနုာ်လီၤလၢ နကမၤလိတၢ်ဆူညါအဂီၢ်တက့ၢ်.

segment.source: Welcome, and thank you for your purchase! To begin, please watch the video to your left, test your browser, and then sign in using your username and password.

The objective of the course is to provide peer specialists with information about the principals and characteristics of opioid use disorders and approaches to treatment and recovery (e.g., medication assistant treatment) so peers are informed and prepared to support the individuals they serve.

segment.target: ကသံၣ်အိဖံဝဲးအသီဒီး အဟဲအိၣ်ဖျါထီၣ်တဖၣ်
ကသံၣ်အိဖံဝဲးအသီဒီး အဟဲအိၣ်ဖျါထီၣ်တဖၣ်

segment.source: A timely update to the opioid crisis, which has evolved from opioid over-prescription to one of growing illegal access everywhere.
Introduction to Culturally Affirming Peer Support
Introduction to Culturally Affirming Peer Support

The course provides peer specialists and others with a professional interest in substance use disorder recovery, insight into six of Minnesota’s diverse cultures, and learning experiences in cultural responsiveness. The course explores cultural differences and encourages peer specialists to be mindful of such differences and how they impact their relationship with the persons they serve. Participants work through real-world interactive exercises that help build skills for engaging and productive relationships with persons from diverse cultures.
Lesson One: History and Overview of the Opioid Epidemic
Lesson Two: Opioids 101 — A Brief Overview of the Types and Effects of Opioids
Lesson Three: Opioid Use Disorder Treatment and Recovery
Opioid Training for Peer Specialists Completion Certificate
New and Emerging Opioids: A Supplement to Opioid Training for Peer Specialists
New and Emerging Opioids Completion Certificate
Lesson One: Minnesota’s Mosaic of Cultures
segment.target: တၢ်မၤလိ တၢ- Minnesota အလီၢ်ကျဲလၢအိၣ်ဒီး တၢ်ဆဲးတၢ်လၤအါမး

segment.source: Lesson Two: The Principles of Cultural Affirmation
Lesson Three: Putting Cultural Responsiveness into Action
Culturally Affirming Peer Support Completion Certificate

In this lesson, you’ll learn appropriate terminology in describing substance use disorders such as Opioid Use Disorder (OUD), the incidence rates of national substance use and use disorders, the history of opioid use, the current state of opioid use nationally and in Minnesota, and how to use this knowledge to bring an informed approach to interactions with persons you serve.

In this lesson, you’ll learn to identify and describe the types of opioids and their derivation, describe how opioids affect the brain and body, describe the physical process through which opioids create dependence, and consider how to apply this information when you provide support to an individual with an Opioid Use Disorder (OUD).

In this lesson, you’ll learn to describe a peer’s role in treatment and recovery based on the peer recovery domains, identify maintenance and overdose reversal medications, identify non-medication options used in treatment and recovery, and learn about — and practice — person-centered conversational and motivational interviewing techniques when providing support to persons you serve.
To view and print your certificate press the Launch button.

The course examines the evolving opioid crisis with an emphasis on illegal opioids, synthetic opioid-like substances, and stimulants that are becoming increasingly available everywhere in Minnesota. The course familiarizes peer specialists and others with a professional interest in substance use and recovery with the nature of the new drugs and the risks and dangers posed by each.
To view and print your certificate press the Launch button.

Lesson One identifies Minnesota’s wide range of diverse cultures and surveys six prominent cultures, emphasizing language, customs, values, and traditions as key distinguishing characteristics of each. Participants acquire knowledge and skills for navigating cultural differences among those they serve, building cultural responsiveness and competence to help strengthen those relationships.

Lesson Two focuses on cultural awareness and introduces key principles for initiating and maintaining productive interactions and relationships with persons from diverse cultures. The lesson explores cultural differences and their impact on communication. It emphasizes skills to overcome barriers and provide culturally affirming support.

Lesson Three transitions from learning to doing by practicing concepts learned in previous lessons. Participants are challenged to identify and successfully bridge cultural differences by engaging in several interactive scenarios. This learn-by-doing approach enables participants to develop and grow their ability to navigate relationships with people from different cultures by establishing rapport, adjusting communication styles, and avoiding and repairing microaggressions.
To view and print your certificate press the Launch button.

source.pc: Hi, {0}, and welcome to MCB’s Online Training for Peer Specialists!
You are on your personal home page.

On the right, you’ll see the course list. Click on a course title to reveal the course description and a summary of each lesson. As you work your way through the course, your status will be updated to reflect your progress.
Click the Launch button to the right of the available lesson to begin. The lessons must be taken in the order presented. When you complete a lesson, the next lesson will unlock.
You do not have to complete a lesson in one session. If you EXIT before completing a lesson, we’ll remember where you left off and bring you back to the right point when you return.
For your convenience, bookmark this page. Alternatively, sign in at www.mcboard.org.
Thank you for participating in this online training program. Thank you, too, for your commitment to helping others in their recovery journey.
NOTE: These courses are not designed to be viewed on a Smartphone. Please use a tablet, laptop or desktop computer.
For any technical or connection issues, please email us at {1}.

target.pc: တလိၣ်လၢ နကမၤဝံၤ တၢ်မၤလိတဖၣ် တဘျီဃီဘၣ်. နမ့ၢ်ဟးထီၣ် တချုးလၢ နမၤဝံၤ တၢ်မၤလိတခါဒံးဘၣ်န့ၣ်, ပကတိၢ်နီၢ် တၢ်လီၤဖဲ နထွးထီၣ်ဒီး ဖဲနဟဲက့ၤနုာ်လၢခံတဘျီအခါ ပကအိးထီၣ်ကဒါက့ၤ တၢ်လီၢ်အံၤလီၤ.
လၢကညီလၢနဂီၢ်အဂီၢ်, မးနီၣ်လံာ်ကဘျံးအံၤတက့ၢ်, လၢခံတဘျီ, ဆဲးလီၤမံၤနုာ်လီၤဖဲ www.mcboard.org တက့ၢ်.

တၢ်မၤလိလၢ ထီၣ်တထီၣ်ဃုထၢသ့တဖၣ်

segment.source: These courses are optional and were made available to you outside of a curriculum.

source.pc: For any technical or connection issues, please email us at {0}.

pc.pc: This course is best viewed on a desktop or laptop computer, or on newer iPad or Android tablets. It is not designed to be viewed on a smartphone.
If you are taking the course in a corporate setting be sure that your organization allows access to external websites.
You do not have to complete the course in one session. We encourage you to press NEXT before exiting. Failing to do so will require you to view again the last viewed slide before moving forward.
This self-directed course has been designed to be completed in three hours. Your time to complete may vary.
Upon completion of the course you will receive a personalized Completion Certificate.
Windows: Chrome, Edge, Firefox (latest versions), and IE11.
Apple iOS tablets: Safari and Google Chrome (latest versions).
Android OS6 or later: Google Chrome (latest version).

target.pc: တၢ်လၢပဂ့ၤသ့ၣ်ညါ

pc.pc: Windows: Chrome, Edge, Firefox (ဘၢရှၢၣ် လၢခံကတၢၢ်), ဒီး IE11.
Mac: Safari ဒီး Firefox (ဘၢရှၢၣ် လၢခံကတၢၢ်).
Apple iOS tablets: Safari ဒီး Google Chrome (ဘၢရှၢၣ် လၢခံကတၢၢ်).
Android OS6 မ့တမ့ၢ် အသီလၢခံ- Google Chrome (ဘၢရှၢၣ် လၢခံကတၢၢ်).
